Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Bucko007
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as part of a class trip to Europe. The hotel staff was awesome and helped us out with storing our bags for the day. The rooms were nice and located near a mall and the Berlin Wall. The breakfast was also great especially compared to the hotels we stayed at in France. Would stay here again for a trip.

Reviews.Title: “good as any other Ibis”
Reviews.Author: ioana i
Reviews.Content: Ibis Ost is as good as any other Ibis, good beds, reasonable breakfast, small rooms, competitive pricing, and so forth. From the Airport you can get a taxi - 20 euro, so is not so farr... I recomand this Hotel for a goog price!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, price and breakfast”
Reviews.Author: jorge m
Reviews.Content: Good location... Close to AlexanderPlatz. The only glitch here is that during nightime this place is surrounded by drunks... So be careful when you return alone, or take a taxi to leave you in front but be prepared to knock because they lock the doors... Also, I dont know why but the room was extremely hot and the ac did not work so I had to open the window... Anyhow, I liked the breakfast...

Reviews.Title: “Stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Central climat system is working loudly, it was necessary to open a window for fresh sleep. Coffee machine (with all functions) is placed in 2nd dining room (hidden), so we were used 1st one with poor coffee drink.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value Stay”
Reviews.Author: barnmeister
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this Ibis for 1 night as we were attending a concert at the O2 world ( Germany's finest export.."Rammstein" ) and it's only 10-15 minutes walk away. Simple, basic but comfortable room, met all the requirements. Easy access into the main tourist areas via the s-bahn at the Ostbanhof, 2-3 mins away. Reception staff were very nice and helpful, didn't have the breakfast as we were off to the airport fairly early but looked popular when we passed the breakfast area. As previous reviewers have said the local area is pretty bleak but never felt unsafe returning to the hotel late at night. Supermarkets, snacks and sit down meals all available at the Ostbanhof, East side gallery for the Berlin wall 10-15 mins away (opposite the O2 world), all in all a decent basic low cost hotel, would use again.

Reviews.Title: “O2 World Ost”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at the Ibis Berlin Ost Hotel while attending a Rammstein concert at 02 World just down the street. My room was very comfortable, bright, and clean; the hotel location was perfect for me since it was very close to both the Berlin Ostbahnhof and the music venue. The walk to O2 World was fun since it spanned the majority of the outdoor "East Side Art Gallery" of the old Berlin Wall. It was also a short walk to Alexanderplatz for food and shopping.

Reviews.Title: “SUPER-SUPER!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: SUPER-SUPER! one off the best hotels, wee have sleept in, in Berlin. The breakfast is olso one off the best in Berlin. Rooms is super-super and the service is perfect.. All persons in the hotel is very kind and helpfull, SUPER-SUPER

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is OK, location not so good”
Reviews.Author: Strkr46
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in the near on Ostbahnhof and is therefore very easy to reach. It is a typical Ibis Hotel. The staff are extremely friendly and the rooms are quiet. Cleanliness could however be improved (for instance, there was dust behind and below the curtains), but is acceptable. Reaching the center is not difficult and relatively quick (3 minute walk and 2 S-Bahn stops to reach Alexanderplatz). There are many shops in the nearby Ostbahnhof, as well as cafes and supermarkets. This is interesting for those willing to save some money, as it is a good alternative to breakfast in the Ostbahnhof instead of paying the Ibis breakfast (which at 10€ is in my opinion overpriced for those who don't eat much early in the morning). The location of the hotel isn't that nice itself, as the area is quite dark and empty at night and might feel unsafe. That said, I can recommend the hotel especially to people willing to reach the centre (Alexanderplatz) with minimal walk and public transport, and who want to avoid the business of Berlin Mitte.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: HectorFromBerne
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a lot to commend it. It is conveniently located, five minutes walk (more or less, according to the state of the traffic lights) from the Ostbahnhof, with good connections for airport and intercity trains. It is an Ibis, hence clean and efficient. The breakfast buffet is imaginatively and well stocked. The downside is that although the hotel is adjacent to the river, it is in the wasteland where the wall used to run - interesting historically, but no elegant buildings nearby (though the pumping station next door has considerable charm). We would have welcomed tea and coffee-making facilities and a slightly roomier shower and toilet. Our original booking was cancelled because we failed to arrive by 1900 (something not shown in the small print), but the staff were obliging and helpful. Good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, great value for money”
Reviews.Author: alankiddle
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff, overall great value for money would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Ibis Berlin City Ost”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Ibis Berlin City Ost for 2 nights whilst attending a concert at the O2 world, main reason for using the hotel was it's close location to the O2 ( 10 mins walk ). Excellent value, good rate booked on-line via Accor hotel website, 2 mins walk from the Ostbanhof main station, basic but comfortable room, very pleasant staff and ideal if visiting the O2. Also the East-side gallery with the longest remaining part of the Berlin wall is 10 mins walk away. Easy access into the centre of Berlin via the s-bahn so if you want a decent price hotel whilst exploring Berlin then this is a good option. Will certainly use again when visiting the O2 again in a couple of weeks.

Reviews.Title: “Great quick stop!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night so I could take the early train out of town. Great location, only 2 blocks from the train station. Clean, simple, has everything you need. Wi-fi in the lobby a plus. Wi-fi in the room for a small charge. Great quick stop.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for a City tour!”
Reviews.Author: macarne
Reviews.Content: The Ibis Hotel Berlin City Ost is located next to the Berlin Ost train station and so you are very central. The rooms are quite and clean. The breakfast for 10 Euro is good and you have a large selection of food and coffee. Sure you will find no luxury stuff in this hotel but all in all I was very happy.

Reviews.Title: “Another trouble-free stay”
Reviews.Author: Warsaw61 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Probably the 15th time I've used Ibis at Ostbahnhof and, now it's recovered from the renovation, everything is back to the usual Ibis clean, polite and functional model. I can't see any point in making a stupid rule about a minimum of 200 characters for a review. I can't imagine anyone of the SMS generation filling these in. A perfectly senisble review can be one concise sentence

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location.”
Reviews.Author: Juniper4MP
Reviews.Content: Hotel City Ost is just a couple minutes by foot to Ostbahnhof where you can hop on a train and access the whole city or get a bite to eat or even do some grocery shopping. It is very close to the East Side Gallery and is right on the bank of the Spree which is very pretty in the morning. The breakfast is generous and has a lot of variety. A better breakfast than most hotels in this price range. The staff was mostly very nice and helpful with an occasional misunderstanding but everyone meant well. My only complaint was that my key kept not working. I kept it far from my phone but it would still not work when I would return to my room. They were okay reissuing me a new card each time but it was an unnecessary inconvenience. I was there for 6 nights and went through at least 5 key cards. The rooms are very clean and the beds are futon style and comfortable. The rooms have nice little TVs and many channels. The bathrooms were nicely sized, clean and everything worked properly. The hotel bar was fun, my friends and I stopped in for a beer or a drink most nights. The bartender was lovely and put up with all the foreigners graciously. I would stay here again and recommend to friends.

Reviews.Title: “The managers didnt knew what they were doing at check in/out”
Reviews.Author: Martin_Aar
Reviews.Content: We had booked 3 rooms (2+2+3) on the internet a few month before our trip - At checkin they didnt managed to have our 3 rooms close to each other - and one of the room was on another floor. The day before departure we went down to pay for the breakfast, and the manager said everything was fine when we had paid. At checkout they had very big problems to see what was paid - So we saved about 100 euros because our bill was a big mess. The hotel was very nice and the breakfast was almost perfect, but no low fat milk. - The location is also very good, close to Ostbahnhof with connection to the S-bahn - and about 15min walk to Alexanderplatz

Reviews.Title: “Confortable IBIS standard”
Reviews.Author: AlenaSir
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Berlin for 2 days in Spring - and I can recommended this hotel. You can easily park your car in front of the Ostbahnhof station witch is very close to the hotel (200 meters). Great staff, great breakfast, clean room. Everything was perfect. I just wanted to draw attention to the distance from the center. You have to walk quite a far to the Berlin centre - but if you are getting used to it and you are there only for couple of days it´s ok. We used a bus only twice. I recommend to visit: Unter den Linden, Reichstag (you have to book a visit two days before your visit!), Holocaust Manhmal - indescribable, you have to see.

Reviews.Title: “TOP HOTEL FOR CITY VISIT”
Reviews.Author: conrad57 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We had a top city visit to Berlin thanks to the Ibis Hotel City Ost: - breakfast was SPLENDID and TOP QUALITY - TOP CLEAN a good place to have breakfast and good sleep after CITY VISIT. Evening and night the HOTEL PUB is open to offer drinks and snacks. HONEST PRICES - hotel staff was PROFESSIONAL - OUTMOST HELPFULL - FRIENDLY - there is easy access to the hotel for vehicles, we drove by minibus straight from motorway in the city and HOTEL CAR PARK - Berlin City ( Alexanderplatz ) HOP ON HOP OFF bus is on walking distance - I was in this hotel 6 years ago and had a good time, I recommended this hotel to our family group for the city visit. It was a GOOD CHOICE. We like good breakfast food, staff professionalism and clean rooms, it was TOP CLASS to PRICE/QUALITY

Reviews.Title: “I would stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: alley3898
Reviews.Content: This was another basic European hotel. The rooms were simple but all amenities were available. Wifi in the lobby, continental breakfast, etc. The hotel and rooms were very clean- I believe this place was brand new when I stayed. Despite it being so simple I really enjoyed my stay here. It is close to the train station, mall and some bars & nightclubs. You can also walk the Berlin Wall right down the street. I would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Close to train station and confortable”
Reviews.Author: giemeigi
Reviews.Content: The hotel is close to the train station Berlin Ostbanhob; room and bathroom really clean. The bed was confortable and with clean sheets.

Reviews.Title: “positively surprised”
Reviews.Author: ItalianNomad
Reviews.Content: having stayed at Ibis hotels in other places before and never had a good experience, I was worried when the client told me that they booked me into the Ibis Berlin City Ost. In my mind I already made plans to book another hotel on my own dime but decided to go to the Ibis first. I was greeted very friendly, the room was large and clean with hard wood floors which I prefer over carpet, the location was fine, close to the Ostbahnhof (eastern station) from where you can easily get around. Breakfast was fine, not like some of the other Ibis I have stayed at where you get everything from machines. If you need a place that is not too expensive and need it to be clean and you like a large room, this place can be recommended. My overall rating would be GOOD . not very good, but also not average... Of course there are nicer places to stay for the same money but they might not be found and bookable through the internet.

Reviews.Title: “Just another good Ibis”
Reviews.Author: ThiagoT
Reviews.Content: If you already stayed in an Ibis, you know what to expect. We stayed 3 nights in this unit and please find below our conclusions: Location: Good location. 5 minutes walking distance to East Side Gallery (and some beach bars near the gallery). 5 minutes walking distance to Ostbanhof station. Just 2 stations from Alexanderplatz. However, please note that you will need to use the tube to visit most of the city's landmarks. Rooms: standard Ibis room format. Our room was new and well maintained. Common areas: nice and big reception lounge, 2 free computers with internet, bar with music and free wifi (only in the bar). Breakfast: standard Ibis breakfast. Staff: I read some bad reviews about the staff, however, in my opinion they were polite in the German way. They will help you if you ask. In my reviews, I usually give 3 or 4 stars to Ibis. For this one, I will give 4.

Reviews.Title: “good price x quality”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very good, with good price but a little distant from city center (restaurants and activities). However, there is a train station very close with fullness of trains. I recommend for families and budget travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed quality in staff, not free internet”
Reviews.Author: snorerkid
Reviews.Content: The hotel is ok. Clean and minimalistic functional room. Location is really nice, located close to Spree with many interesting places around. Breakfast was a little bellow normal quality, but not bad in any way. Problem with this hotel is that the staff is not really trained properly nor did they seem very professional. Don't know if it's correct, but it seems like hotel is staffed by students or poorly trained personnel, because I was not impressed by them. They claim that internet is free, but that's only in the reception with 2 PC's that's often taken. The wifi didn't work in the reception when I tested it so I had to pay €9 to get internet, which is a bit stiff price. I paid €70 for the room. Although we asked on the hotel if there was bike rental close by, they sent us to Alexander plz, but we found a bike rental at a place called Yaam close by for €10 a day. Seeing Berlin without a bike is just silly so go rent one and save your feet from all the walking.

Reviews.Title: “Basic Ibis”
Reviews.Author: petrjarv
Reviews.Content: If you have ever been in one Ibis you have been to all of them. So basically this is just another Ibis. Service was ok, room and bathroom were clean and spotless. Location is very near to Ostbahnhof. Basic Ibis hotel: no thrills and cheap price.

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel was ideally placed within view of the train station (which has a direct connection to the city and other important tourist sites) and close to a couple of Berlin's attractions, as well as a number of eateries and shops. I have no complaints about the equipment available in my room. My room's size and cleanliness was more than adequate, and I'm glad that the hotel does not use the flat pillows common in Germany. The mattress was a little hard, but it's difficult to cater for every guest. The service available was very good. They were patient, and although I used this trip to practice my German, it was clear that the staff who deal directly with customers are fluent in English. My only suggestion would be that the breakfast plates be moved closer to the dining hall's entrance. The first time I was there, I selected food as soon as I had fetched my tray. Because I initially couldn't see the plates, I did not take any cold meat or cheese, having nothing but the tray to place them on.

Reviews.Title: “Best value, location and service”
Reviews.Author: gpk2011
Reviews.Content: room - clean, good condition and housekeeping, airconditioned, not very small. slight noise from nearby road. breakfast - very good free breakfast included in the long weekend offer. internet - free wifi of decent speed available at the hotel lobby. staff - friendly and helpful. good location - 5 mins easy walk takes you to the ostbahnhof railway station; from here easy to reach other parts of town.

Reviews.Title: “Cramped But Clean”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Usual Ibis standard. Room extreamly cramped, to the extent that beside tables has been folded away to make it a twin bedded room. Very clean but shower door broken. Hotel reception being refurbished so builders dust everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, quiet room in budget hotel in East Berlin.”
Reviews.Author: BatonRougewanderer
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a very good European budget hotel. The rooms are clean and standard size for Europe (meaning very small by American standards). The breakfast was good, and the bar was pleasant. If you stay here, request more towels after you check in. You are only given one towel per person, and it is pretty thin.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel near Ostbanhof”
Reviews.Author: smkd1980
Reviews.Content: This hotel located at the East part of Berlin near to Ostnanhof railway station, that was very convinient for me - there is direct express train to Shonefeld airport (about 20 minutes on the way). I like Ibis hotels - because this hotel gruop provides the same accomodation in every hotel around the world (no surprised - all rooms are almost all the same). This hotel is not an exception - small room with new and modern furniture, LCD TV, good bed. But WiFi internet was not free in this hotel, and it was about 9 euro for 24 hours. I did not take breakfast, instead of this I was going to Ostbahnof terminal and having kebab and coke (~3 euro). Very testy!!!

Reviews.Title: “Recommended”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I've given the hotel an overall four star rating based on value for money and efficient and friendly service. The bar was very pleasant and the breakfast room more than adequate. The room was a little spartan, but it is after all a budget hotel and we only slept in it. One negative point was that our first room was very hot (the ac only functioned as a heater) and opening the window made it too noisy. We were, however, immediately given a quieter room at the back when we raised this at reception. The location wasn't ideal, especially in the very cold weather, but the east railway station was just across the road and the underground a relatively short walk away. Overall we were very satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Ostbahnhof”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel needs to provide more towels, one thin one is not enough. There should also be a bath mat when one steps out of the shower. The shower drainage needs to be checked regularly; I had to shower standing in ankle-high soap water.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel fully meets the high standard I have learned to expect from Ibis hotels”
Reviews.Author: citiboyDerby Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: For a brief business trip, covering a conference outside the city, this hotel has everything that is required. However, I am sufficiently impressed to plan to stay at the same hotel for an upcoming week's holiday in Berlin (its central location meant that I wsa able to see enough of Berlin from the train to the conference to make me want to return)r

Reviews.Title: “Great value for a 2 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: aussiecouple45
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ibis Berlin for 1 night as we have an apartement for the rest of our time here. I actually was suprised when my husband said the Ibis is only a 2 star hotel. Room was basic but very clean. Bed comfortable and ncie size room. Our flight got in at 7am and we got to the hotel around 9ish and they checked us straight into a room which was really great. We had an amazing view of the TV tower which was also very nice. The hotel is a two minute walk to a main train s-bahn station. I would suggest this hotel to anyone who wants a cheap Berlin say. Oh by the way, we paid 110 euro for the room and 10 euro each for breakfast which was all the basics and well worth it!!! Had all the usuals and more.

Reviews.Title: “Your Basic Travel Hotel for your Basic Travel Needs”
Reviews.Author: harry1125
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three days and two nights. When we first arrived. The neighborhood seemed pretty sketchy and dirty, but it didn't let my hopes down just yet. We arrived to our very small room, nice and clean, but very small (just enough room for beds, and a few suitcases). The bathroom in our room was also nice, clean and updated (still very small, but that's what you're going to get in Europe). We had a good sleep on the very comfortable beds, no noise, no disturbance. Breakfast the next morning was the best part. They have EVERYTHING and it's all great food, too. The hotel also has a nice bar and a lounge area. There is also a FREE computer with FREE internet in the hotel lobby (most European travel hotels have computers, but you have to pay for them). We had a nice two night stay here at the Ost(east) Berlin ibis, it seemed to be a great travel hotel. The only thing I have to complain is the surrounding area is NOT the most desirable parts of Berlin (also quite boring). But the good thing about the location is the big East Train Station which is just a short walk down the block.

Reviews.Title: “Cheerful and cheap”
Reviews.Author: DrMonkFish
Reviews.Content: 2 night stay with friends. Hotel handy to S-bahn and as the public transport in Berlin is so good the location, although seemly remote, is not an issue. Also close to a decent strip of the remaining Berlin wall for some quick sightseeing. There also seems to be a strip of buildings occupied by artists between the hotel and the wall and a beech bar (with real sand). Room clean, happily stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Does what it says on the tin”
Reviews.Author: fifionly
Reviews.Content: No frills hotel that delivers for the price we paid, as long as one is not expecting anything flash. Hotel staff were mostly accommodating, and the location wasn't too bad - a bit isolated, but it's only a couple of stops on the S-Bahn to Alexanderplatz, the centre of East Berlin. Only major criticism is the air-con didn't work very well - made the right noise, but not much air movement. And opening the window only lets in lots of traffic noises. Ok for overnight/ 2 night stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: girl2314
Reviews.Content: Except from the fact that it is very close to the train station I don't really see anything good about the location of this hotel. There is nothing around except the train station, i.e., no nice restaurants or bars. Fortunately the hotel has a bar where you can have something to eat if you don't want to go too far at night. Otherwise the hotel is pretty good, clean, very good breakfast, and the train station makes it quite easy to go to any place a tourist may want to go. Overall a good value for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: GinaG
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights/3 days in March with colleagues on business. The hotel is very central and just opposite the Ostbanhof (station) and it's very easy to get to anywhere you might want to go. Check in was very quick and efficient and we were all expected, our keys were ready and we were all in our allocated rooms very quickly. The rooms were all very clean - not massive, but really had everything you could want or need. Nice double bed, TV (quite a few stations but not many in English - CNN was ok for news though). There were bedside tables, wardrobe and plenty of room for all my bits and pieces. The bathroom was smallish but with a nice sink and shower (no bath) and everywhere was clean and tidy. There is a dispenser by the sink and in the shower with hand/body/hair shampoo which is quite mild and adequate. There is also a nice small powerful hairdryer in the bathroom too which came in handy. Only problem I did find was that the bathroom did tend to get a bit flooded after a shower, but I soon mopped it up and it was fine. Room service is available and there are menus - but I didn't try these. I did have the breakfast which I found very good - you just go down and help yourself to whatever you want. There is a choice of various cold meats, cheeses, salad stuff, etc and plenty of cereals, yoghurts etc. A really nice selection of fresh - and still warm - rolls and bread with jams, honey etc. Plenty of hot tea, coffee etc. All in all - just what you need in the morning. The reception staff and bar staff were all very friendly and helpful and, thankfully, all spoke very good English. All in all, our party all thought that the hotel was very good in all areas - extremely good value for money too. It's not in the most glamorous area, but as I said before it's certainly central to enable you to get the train to wherever you might fancy going.

Reviews.Title: “Smooth Ibis Ostbahnhof”
Reviews.Author: Simon3113
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night only on a recent trip to Berlin. My other hotel didn't inform me that I had to check in before 12am so I was stuck. Checked a couple more places around Ostbahnhof but they were all full. When I saw the Ibis sign I went straight there as I had chances to stay at Ibis before and always had a good time. They had a room available, standard rate as all Ibis hotels. The guy at the desk was very nice and cheerful, check in was quick, went up to the room that was large and clean. All rooms at Ibis are the same but always very confortables. I went to the bar to have a beer with a friend that picked me up at the airport, the same guy at the front desk served us, always with a big smile. Breakfast next day was great, good quality and lots of it, it was not included in the room rate but it costs only 9.50€. Check out was as well very smooth the girl was very nice and friendly. Ostbahnhof is across the street, and from there you can get to Mitte in 2 quick stops. The hotel is next to the river and if you have a top floor room as I did, you can see the tv tower. If I didn't have the other hotel booked I would have stayed here for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: DylanLs
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in the Ibis Hotel for several nights in different years, mainly serving as a stopover on our way to other locations in Europe. It's one of the cheaper options - i got a rate as low as 41 euros through online booking. Although the area, around to Ostbahnhof, is dull and there's not much to do, the hotel itself is great with friendly staff and a cosy bar, and since it's so close to the station you can get anywhere in just a few minutes. I can recommend the hotel to anyone not willing to spend a lot of money yet seeking for the comfort Ibis is known for.

Reviews.Title: “Not expensive, good location - You won't do better in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: 8002reverse
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 times. Good location. A great busy hotel with good breakfast and bar. Have not eaten there. 5 mins. walk from railway station that has everything. So many things nearby. Secure underground parking. Google Earth garage entrance (on different street to lobby entrance): 52°30'37.34"N 13°25'45.68"E

Reviews.Title: “A Great Base”
Reviews.Author: beamoSuttonColdfield
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed a Three Night Break .24 Men took 12 Double rooms to celebrate a 50th Birthday. Flying from East Midlands and staying from Thursday till Sunday. The hotel was clean and tidy and adequate for our requirements. Dont bother with Breakfast the Station complex across the road offers a far better selection. Location a little remote for the attractions but very convenient for the station. The staff were excellent speaking excellent English. If you like that early morning Cuppa,take the jug kettle as there are no room facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Base”
Reviews.Author: Vegasking
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Ibis Ostbahnhof for two night in July. The hotel is pretty standard for an Ibis differences from anywhere else in the world is a nice little bar serving good german beer. It is clean, comfortable and the staff all speak a multitude of languages. The hotel is located around 5 minutes walk across the dual-carriageway from the railway station. I can understand why previous posters on here have stated that it can be a little hard to find in the dark. Basically you just walk straight out of the main entrance of the Ostabahnhof railway station over two lanes of traffic and turn right on the other side, the Ibis is then 2 minutes walk. The hotel is ideal as a base particularly if you are flying in/out of Shonefeld, as after your stay you can leave your luggage in lockers at the railway station go explore more of Berlin and then call off at Ostbahnhof on the way back to pick your bags up, then continue onwards to the airport. Another plus on staying here is the nearby East side gallery at 1 mile longest remaining section of the Berlin wall which is 5 minutes from the Ibis straight down the dual carriageway past the station. Ostbahnhof is only 2 stops from Alexanderplatz by S-Bahn and from there you can travel anywhere in Berlin ideal if you are using an all day 6.10 euro travel card.

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: dm99
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed 4 nights at the Ibis Ostbahnhof hotel in Berlin. While the hotel is very near the Ostbahnhof train station, we arrived late at night and found it slightly hard to find in the dark, in the icy cold Berlin wind! We checked in at 11pm with no problem, and our room was just as requested, double, no-smoking. The hotel is in a good location for east berlin, right next to the Spree (river) and an easy walk (15-20 mins) to Alexander Platz. It is also very close to one of the longest remaining sections of the Berlin Wall that stretches for about a kilometer south of the hotel parallel with the river. The room was very clean and neat, but perhaps lacking a bit of atmosphere. The bathroom was very functional with an excellent shower with great temperature control and water pressure. The bed appeared to be king size, with a very firm mattress. The hotel does serve breakfast and other meals, but we never dined there. Many cheap food options are located in the Ostbahnhof, or a short S Bahn ride away into central Berlin. The hotel also provides a computer terminal in the foyer which guests may use free of charge. There is also wifi internet access available for a fee, ask at reception for a voucher as you can get a better deal through the hotel rather than signing up directly with your credit card. We booked directly through the hotel website and got a great deal of 49 Euro per night. Would recommend it to anyone looking for a budget option in east Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value; Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Rodolfo069
Reviews.Content: Me and three friends stayed at the IBIS Ostbahnhof for 4 nights during the Football World Champioship. Location is perfect (just opposite the Ostbahnhof and just 30 minutes taxi drive from Tegel Airport), rooms quite comfortable and staff very friendly. I really recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “German efficiency!”
Reviews.Author: Diplomatic_Spouse
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for two nights in Jan. 2006. The best thing it's got going for it is it's a fairly new building, so everything looks new, it's comfy, a tad small, and cheap! We paid 49 euros a night. There's nothing around the neighborhood really, but you can go into the Ostbahnhof station across the street and get a quick bite to eat. It's not a bad place to stay at all if this is your cheapest option, but you can find similar places like this with a more colorful neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Tourists on a budget!”
Reviews.Author: hiuc38
Reviews.Content: This was the cheapest decent looking hotel deal that I could find in Berlin. It certainly provided excellent value for money and I would recommend it to anyone who wants nice, clean but not luxury accomodation as a base for exploring the city. I cannot stress how ideal the location is. The hotel is directly opposite the ostbahnhof (which is the main train station of East Berlin) so it is absolutely perfect for travelling to all the main sites. The Alexanderplatz is about a 20 minute walk from the hotel and the Reichstag is about 25 minutes on the S-bahn. However, if you do choose this hotel I would make sure that you familiarise yourself with the transport system and learn a little basic german so that you get on/off at the right stations! I am lucky that my boyfriend lives in Germany and is a fluent language speaker so that may have made it easier for us to do all the siteseeing. There is free internet access in the reception which is very handy. The bar is also a nice area to chill in the evenings and there is a small menu of barsnacks if you get peckish (e.g. chicken wings etc.) The staff seemed nice enough and we had no problems. I would recommend not paying extra for the breakfast because there are lots of nice places to east in the Ostbahnhof (and Alexanderplatz). We made a point of having breakfast in a different place every day and subsequently got to try lots of different German cuisine at very reasonable prices (cheaper than the hotel breakfast). Overall, this hotel is definitely worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: NB1957
Reviews.Content: Wonderful value for money, spotlessly clean, warm and comfortable. Location is perfect especially if coming from Schonfeldt Airport. Hotel can be seen from Ostbahnhof. 5 mins to Alexanderplatz by fast, efficient and convenient public transport. Have no hesitation in reccomending it to anyone and I have a great deal of experience of staying in hotels.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What a great find. The hotel is in the Eastern part of Berlin, a five minute walk from the Ostbhanhof. The hotel is spotless. The rooms are small but have all the amenities one would need. It is in a very quiet location. One does not hear the traffic on the street. The lobby is small, but clean and there is a lobby bar also. Breakfast is not included in the rate, I paid 44Euros a night, and that can be for one or two persons. The doors to the rooms and even the elvevator work with a key card, so safety is certainly not an issue. From the Ostbahnhof, it is less that five minutes by S-Bahn to Alexanderplatz and another ten minutes to the city centre. This hotel is a great find. I recommend it unconditionaly.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is a well kept secret”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel was exactly what I had wanted and more. Not too much smoke, Excellent prices, good location next to both surface and undergound transport, ATM nearby for sudden infusions of cash, and lots of unpublicized conveniences like free internet and a 24 hour store next door (very convenient for the odd needs of the jet lagged). The staff can be snippy but I found that if I gave it right back, soon we were both laughing about whatever problem started it.
